title: From Music to Sand Painting: the way to multi materials solid freeforming
abstractText:
The grant has been used to support the applicant's presention at the Royal Society Summer Science Exhibition, a four day event which gives thousands of visitors an opportunity to meet and talk to researchers.

The exhibition is the Society's most prestigious event of the year and according to a 2005 MORI poll is the best known science exhibition in the UK. A few thousand visitors included potential university students, scientists, policy makers, MPs, captains of industry, representatives from funding bodies and research councils, teachers  and the wider scientific community.

After the exhibition we have also been invited into more public engagements including National Science and Engineering Week, World Scouting Jamboree, Brighton Science Festival, Big Bang, outreach at the Thomas Hardye School, Intech Science Centre and Planetarium, Cheltenham Science Festival, Bestival Isle of Wight, etc.
